channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024061084
item.description:
Report X-2024061084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging is wet on all sides and the underside was ripped open. Inside are 4 qty of 1 gallon plastic bottles of Diversey Suma Cal-X. One of the bottles was dented and a streak of liquid can still be seen that is coming from under the cap. About 6 fl oz is missing from the bottle and is spilled on to the box.The rest of the items were wet but undamaged.

item.title: Report E-2024060366
item.description:
Report E-2024060366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, at 0257 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of Unitex Melt Down Plus. Roadrunner terminal personnel discovered the release of 5 gallons of Unitex Melt Down Plus (UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S(Ethanolamine) 8, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The release was caused by a puncture and contained to an area inside the trailer. Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and containerized the waste in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged it onsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060422
item.description:
Report E-2024060422

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, four (4) one-gallon jugs of UN3149 were punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected the damaged jugs, and impacted cardboard box, for disposal. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN3149-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) vented 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061077
item.description:
Report X-2024061077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: ROCKLIN
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 6th, a package was found leaking during the AM sort. It had a Ground Limited Quantity label on it but no other DG Markings. When the package was moved it sounded like Aerosol cans, further investigation showed that the package contained 24 aerosol cans and one of them had activated causing the leak. Package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held at the location pending disposition.

  • Description: Notification for container # HGIU 525074 leaking at the intermodal facility in the Lathrop Yard in French Camp, CA. Contractor responded and found one 55-gallon drum was leaking from the lid on the drum releasing a total of 5 gallons. Contractor replaced the defected drum lid and cleaned all impacted areas properly.

item.description:
Report E-2024060157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-ounces of CitriStrip Paint & Varnish Stripping Gel, was released from one (1) 0.5-gallon plastic jug due to improper dunnage and bracing around the package, causing it to get crushed during transit and leak onto the cardboard container. No surfaces were impacted. The terminal had already placed the contents into a 5-gallon poly drum prior to the call.

item.description:
Report E-2024060149

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 4-teaspoons of battery acid (hazardous - UN2794) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the pallet. The caller advised the release onto the pallet has dried and there is no waste to contain, and there no damage to the battery. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
